keyword: calories in a can of green beans
title: Calories in a Can of Green Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in a can of green beans, including full nutrition breakdown per drained can, macros, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better health.
h1: Calories in a Can of Green Beans
assumptions: Standard 15 oz (425g) can, drained solids (~240g), regular sodium, no added fats or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sodium content, packing liquid, and draining method. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard can of drained green beans provides ~53 kcal, 10g fiber, and is low in fat and protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a can of green beans drained?
faqs.a: About 53 kcal for a standard 240g drained can.

faqs.q: Are canned green beans high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, regular cans have ~564 mg sodium; opt for low-sodium or rinse to reduce.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in a can of green beans?
faqs.a: Approximately 4.8 g dietary fiber per drained can.

faqs.q: Do canned green beans have added sugars?
faqs.a: Minimal natural sugars (~5.3 g per can); no added sugars in plain varieties.

faqs.q: How do calories compare for fresh vs canned green beans?
faqs.a: Similar low calories (~40-53 kcal per 240g), but canned may have more sodium.
